children.name: Date sent
children.description: Date that the distribution was sent.

children.name: Group category
children.description: A named category of group e.g. Social work, patient representatives to whom the distribution applies.

children.name: Urgent
children.description: If true the notification should be distributed made as a matter of urgency.

children.name: Distribution
children.description: Details of the target of communication distribution, whether to identified individual parties or as a category.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Supplementary information to follow
children.description: True indicates that additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available eg incomplete pathology test results.

children.name: Procedure requested
children.description: Identification of the service requested. This is often coded with an external terminology.

children.name: Latest date service required
children.description: The latest date that is acceptable for the service to be completed.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Request
children.description: Current Activity.

children.name: Supplementary information to follow
children.description: True indicates that additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available eg incomplete pathology test results.

children.name: Procedure requested
children.description: Identification of the service requested. This is often coded with an external terminology.

children.name: Latest date service required
children.description: The latest date that is acceptable for the service to be completed.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Request 3
children.description: Current Activity.

children.name: Procedure request
children.description: Request for a procedure to be performed.

children.name: Regularity
children.description: The observed regularity of the pulse or heart beat.

defining_code.description: The rhythm is regular.
The rhythm is irregular.
The rhythm is regularly irregular.
The rhythm is irregular in a chaotic manner.

children.name: Rate
children.description: The rate, measured in beats per minute.

defining_code.description: The pulse rate, measured in beats per minute.
The heart rate, measured in beats per minute.

children.name: Clinical Description
children.description: Narrative description about the findings.

children.name: Clinical Interpretation
children.description: Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the pulse or heart beat findings.

children.name: structure
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: First event
children.description: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

children.name: Regularity
children.description: The observed regularity of the pulse or heart beat.

defining_code.description: The rhythm is regular.
The rhythm is irregular.
The rhythm is regularly irregular.
The rhythm is irregular in a chaotic manner.

children.name: Rate
children.description: The rate, measured in beats per minute.

defining_code.description: The pulse rate, measured in beats per minute.

children.name: Pulse Presence
children.description: Identification of a pulse or heart beat.

defining_code.description: A pulse or heart beat can be detected.
A pulse or heart beat cannot be detected.

children.name: Clinical Interpretation
children.description: Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the pulse or heart beat findings.

children.name: structure
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Second event
children.description: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

children.name: Rate
children.description: The rate, measured in beats per minute.

defining_code.description: The heart rate, measured in beats per minute.

children.name: structure
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Position
children.description: The body position of the subject during the observation.

defining_code.description: The subject was standing.
The subject was sitting (for example on bed or chair).
The subject was reclining.
The subject was lying flat.

children.name: Confounding Factors
children.description: Narrative description about any incidental factors that may be affect interpretation of the physical findings.

children.name: List
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Maximum
children.description: Maximum rate of the pulse or heart beat observed during a period of exertion.

children.name: history
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Findings Location
children.description: Body site where the pulse or heart beat findings were observed.

defining_code.description: The left radial artery.
The right radial artery.
The region of the heart.
The left carotid artery.
The right carotid artery.
The left femoral artery.
The right femoral artery.

children.name: Unique device identifier (UDI)
children.description: A numeric or alphanumeric string that is associated with this device within a given system.

children.name: Comment
children.description: Additional narrative about the device not captured in other fields.

children.name: Date of manufacture
children.description: Date the device was manufactured.

children.name: Manufacturer
children.description: Name of manufacturer.

children.name: Device name
children.description: Identification of the medical device, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category of device.

children.name: Other identifier
children.description: Unspecified identifier, which can be further specified in a template or at run time.

children.name: Medical Device
children.description: An instrument, apparatus, implant, material or similar, used in the provision of healthcare. In this context, a medical device includes a broad range of devices which act through a variety of physical, mechanical, thermal or similar means but specifically excludes devices which act through medicinal means such as pharmacological, metabolic or immunological methods.  The scope is inclusive of disposable devices as well as durable or persisting devices that require tracking, maintenance activities or regular calibration, recognising that each type of device has specific data recording requirements.

children.name: Method
children.description: Method used to the pulse observe the pulse or heart beat.

defining_code.description: The findings are observed by physical touch of the observer on the subject.
The findings are observed with the assistance of a device, such as a stethoscope.
The pulse findings are observed using a device, such as a pulse oximeter or cardiac monitor.

children.name: List
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Pulse
children.description: Measurement of the pulse rate, or heart rate, and description of associated characteristics.

children.name: Admission method
children.description: How the patient was admitted to hospital.

children.name: Date of admission
children.description: Date patient admitted to hospital.

children.name: Source of admission
children.description: The locaton of the patient immediately prior to admission.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Inpatient admission
children.description: Details of inpatient admission, in accordance with AoMRC headings.

children.name: Protocol - definition
children.description: All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class can contain a PROTOCOL model which records information on how the information was gathered or measured, and any other information that is not required for safe clinical interpretation of the core Data. Datatypes are identical to those explained in the Data model, above.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Quantity
children.description: A quantity data type used to record a measurement associated with its' appropriate units.  These are derived from ISO standards and the Reference model enables conversion between these units. The example shown here is length.

children.name: Interval of Quantity
children.description: Interval of quantity datatypes allow for the recording of a range of measurements in association with appropriate units eg 1-2cm (prescribed amount of cream for a rash).

children.name: Identifier
children.description: Identifier datatypes enable recording of formal data identifiers

children.name: Text that is sourced from an external terminology
children.description: Text data type utilising codes derived from an external terminology source eg a SNOMED-CT, LOINC or ICD subset

children.name: Interval of Integer
children.description: Interval of integer datatype allows for recording of a range of counts eg 1-2 tablets prescribed.  Maximum and minimum values can be set for the lower count and the upper count.

children.name: Date/Time
children.description: Date/Time datatype allows recording of a date and/or time, including partial dates such as year only or month and year only.  Allow all is the default - so all forms of date/time are permitted.

children.name: Choice
children.description: Choice datatype allows for a number of types of element to be specified simultaneously and which can constrained or selected within a template or at run-time.  In this example, a text datatype set to Free text or Coded and another that is constrained to Terminology record data about the same data element.

children.name: Count
children.description: Count data types are composed of an integer with no units eg for recording the number of children - in this example the minimum is set at 0 and the maximum not specified.

children.name: Interval of Date
children.description: Interval of integer datatype allows for recording of a range of dates eg between September 1, 2008 and September 8, 2008.

children.name: Free text or coded
children.description: Text data type in which free text can be entered or coding can be incorporated either in the template or at run time.

children.name: Boolean
children.description: Boolean datatype that allows for true or false answers.

children.name: URI - resource identifier
children.description: URI datatypes allow for recording of relationships from this data to data recorded elsewhere.  These links can be within the same EHR, or external eg to a  URL.

children.name: Ordinal
children.description: Ordinal datatypes pair a number and text - in this way scores can be calculated in software, or progression can be assessed eg if used in a pain score

children.name: Multimedia
children.description: Multimedia datatypes allow for the recording of many types of multimedia files to be captured.  All available types have been explicitly selected in this example.

children.name: Text that uses Internal codes
children.description: Text data type which can use an internal vocabulary.  Each of these 'internal codes' can be bound to a terminology code.

defining_code.description: Patient is lying supine
Patient is reclining, propped up on one medium pillow
Patient is sitting on a chair
Patient is standing

children.name: Proportion
children.description: Proportion datatypes allow for ratios, percent, fractions and proportions to be modelled.

children.name: Any
children.description: The datatype for this 'any' element can be specified or constrained in a template or at run-time, but is not explicitly modelled in the archetype.

children.name: Duration
children.description: Duration datatype allows recording of the duration of clinical concepts.  'Allow all time units' is the default, although specific time units can be explicitly modelled.  Maximum and minum values can be set for each time unit.

children.name: Heading1
children.description: This is a symbol for a cluster which can have other elements 'nested' within it

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Any event
children.description: All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class contain a HISTORY or EVENT model which contains information about the timing of the observation and the 'width' of the information - either a point in time or an inteval.  The default is 'Any event' and it is not specified if this is a Point in time or an Interval

children.name: Event Series
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Demonstration
children.description: Demonstration archetype with descriptions and explanations

defining_code.description: The procedure has been postponed.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
The procedure has been scheduled.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
The procedure has been postponed.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
The procedure has been aborted.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.
Request for procedure sent.
The procedure has been scheduled.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.

children.name: Method 1
children.description: Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.

children.name: Scheduled date/time
children.description: The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.

children.name: Procedure name
children.description: Identification of the procedure by name.

children.name: Final end date/time
children.description: The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure,  was finished.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

defining_code.description: The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
Request for procedure sent.
The procedure has been suspended.
The procedure has been suspended.

children.name: Unstructured name
children.description: Name in free text unstructured format.

children.name: Name type
children.description: Type of name described.

defining_code.description: The name by which the subject is officially registered.
Name previously used by this person.
Name given to this person at birth.
Person also known as.
Other name used by this person.
Name used by this persion before marriage.
The name used by the subject for business or professional purposes.
The subject’s name as it is to be used for reporting, when used with a specific identifier.

children.name: Preferred name
children.description: Indicates that this is the name by which a person chooses to be identified.

children.name: Person name
children.description: Details of personal name of an individual, provider or third party.

children.name: Receiver order identifier
children.description: The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.

children.name: Requestor order identifier
children.description: The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

defining_code.description: The procedure has been aborted.

children.name: Procedure
children.description: A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.

children.name: CPR decision
children.description: The clinical decision on whether cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) should be attempted. In some cases a clear answer may not be available to the recording clinician.

defining_code.description: Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be attempted.
Cardiopulmonary resuscitation should not be attempted.
There is no clear information on the outcome of the CPR decision.

children.name: Date of CPR decision
children.description: The date at which the CPR decision was originally taken or last reviewed.

children.name: Comment
children.description: Other narrative comment pertinent to the CPR decision.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Date for review of CPR decision
children.description: The date at which the CPR decision should be reviewed.

children.name: Discussion with informal carer
children.description: Has resuscitation been discussed with  the patient's informal carer or carers?

defining_code.description: Resuscitation has been discussed with the patient's informal carer.
Resuscitation has not been discussed with the patient's informal carer or carers.
defining_code.value: Resuscitation not discussed with informal carer

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: CPR decision
children.description: The outcome of a clinical decision as to whether cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be undertaken or not. This is generally referred to in UK clinical guidance as the CPR (Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation) decision.

children.name: Ad hoc heading
children.description: A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.

children.name: Period of care identifier
children.description: The period of care to which this composition belongs. This equates to the CONTSYS concept and repesents an admisitrative or contractual spell of care, involving a specific instiution or care provider.

children.name: Context detail
children.description: Additional contextual detail to be applied to all compositions.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

tree.name: Encounter
tree.description: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
